artworks.name: Portrait of Pope Innocent X
artworks.author: Diego Velázquez
artworks.description: Baroque masterpiece depicting Pope Innocent X (c. 1650)

artworks.name: Las Meninas
artworks.author: Diego Velázquez
artworks.description: Complex composition featuring the Infanta Margarita Teresa and her entourage (1656)

artworks.name: Carnation, Lily, Lily, Rose
artworks.author: John Singer Sargent
artworks.description: Impressionist painting of two young girls lighting Chinese lanterns at twilight (1885-1886)

artworks.name: A Bar at the Folies-Bergère
artworks.author: Édouard Manet
artworks.description: Manet's final major work, depicting a barmaid at the famous Parisian nightclub (1882)

artworks.name: Olympia
artworks.author: Édouard Manet
artworks.description: Controversial modernist painting inspired by Titian's Venus of Urbino, caused scandal at the 1865 Paris Salon (1863)

artworks.name: Madame X (Madame Pierre Gautreau)
artworks.author: John Singer Sargent
artworks.description: Portrait of socialite Virginie Amélie Avegno Gautreau, initially controversial but now considered Sargent's masterpiece (1884)

artworks.name: The Daughters of Edward Darley Boit
artworks.author: John Singer Sargent
artworks.description: Innovative group portrait of four sisters in their Paris apartment, influenced by Velázquez's Las Meninas (1882)
